intro: Strychnos smithiana, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are attractive to birds and other wildlife. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and can thrive in dry, arid environments. Despite its ornamental appeal, it contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
